comments_since_last_sample.body: The fact that Rage Against The Machine is not inducted makes the entire HOF a joke. How are they not a first ballot band?

> JAY-Z

Huh?

I’m surprised it took this long for Todd Rundgren to be inducted.

Edit: Max respect to Pat Smear
I love watching Pat play. He's always got this big grin on his face like he's thinking "holy shit! I'm playing guitar in a band! This is pretty cool!"
It's so sad Kurt didn't live long enough to be in there with him! Awesome to see someone from a band (the germs) that people thought were just noise and no good be inducted to the RnR hall of fame.
He seems like a genuinely nice guy, I'm glad for him.
why did it take Carole King this long?
Still Motörhead hasn't been. The RaRHoF is a joke and a fucking travesty.
That’s an unfortunate name.
Tina Turner wasn't already in the Hall of Fame?
Germs is the best band he was in.
In yet another "what the fuck?". How is Tina Turner not in the RR Hall of Fame?
PAP SMEAR
Had Kurt not died, he would have been an official member of Nirvana too.

Todd…

Finally!!

The most glaring omission, IMO, finally made right.

Alex Lifeson’s induction speech is all I need to hear to sum up the rrhof. Good for the guys though. They’ve been doing it for years. Maybe the committee can actually look at Iron Maiden, and Judas Priest more seriously. For that matter, Lionel Richie.
Pat should already be in the Rock Hall for Nirvana, and it’s bullshit they didn’t include him that time
There nothing as antithetical to the idea of rock and roll as the rock and roll hall of fame.

The fact that Iron Maiden, a band that's sold over 75 million albums, if not almost 100 million, and are the elders of metal aren't in their tells me everything. Not that they'd probably care but it's so dumb.
I REALLY hope his grand kids call him Pap.

You mean the "Pop Music Hall of Fame", don't you? They should call it what it is, not what it used to be. I'm not cutting any musical styles down as I like most of them, I'm just being realistic about why it hasn't been about "Rock and Roll for a very long time. Some of the rock bands that have not been inducted while pop music icons get in is embarrassing
Love watching Smear live. He seems so happy to be making music.
What we do is secret. Secret!
Mam O'gram is being inducted next week
I'm in a hotel in downtown Cleveland right now and last night the elevators smelled wildly of marihuanas.
Two former Germs going in the hall today (Belinda Carlisle was briefly a member)

This guy is in the HOF but Phish isn’t?  Their music might not be your cup of tea, but their influence on live music is undeniable. From festivals, groundbreakers in live music streaming to touring success, their induction is long overdue.
Awesome. Well deserved.

>electronic pioneers Kraftwerk are being inducted with the Musical Excellence and Early Influence Awards

So hip hop is rock but not Krautrock.
What a fucking joke.
Fuck the HoF and its shitty ness.
First of all, fuck the rock and roll hall of Fame. Second, took them long enough.
So with this being Dave's second induction I wonder how many other artists have been inducted into the Hall with two different acts. I'm guessing both Ozzy and Black Sabbath are in there right?
Jay-Z?
I misread and thought, the LATE Ozzy?
The RRHOF is a joke.

Time to rewatch [The Decline of Western Civilization](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j0GFOUPsv34&ab_channel=FHS). 

If you haven't seen it, it is a raw look at the LA punk scene in the 1970s. Germs feature prominently.

The people who decide who deserve to be in the RRHF are d…
We talk about Rock music. Can explain to me why Madonna is in?

Sparks? No

Iron Maiden? No

Foreigner? No

The Go Go’s are introduced this year, but sorry they made just four records. But Foreigner who have a huge collection of hits, it’s no!

RRHS…s is for shame

Now we just need to induct Grohl a third time with Queens of the Stone Age. He played drums on arguably their two best records. Most people know about Songs for the Deaf, but he also played on Like Clockwork.

And maybe a fourth with Them Crooked Vultures. /s
Chad Channing should have been inducted.
This is very deserved and I'm really happy to hear it
My heart dropped seeing his name by itself, thinking the worst, but this is fantastic news!
TWO! members of the Germs are being inducted into the Rock and Roll hall of fame this year.    Belinda Carlisle of the Go-Gos was in the Germs at first.

I still hold the opinion that Foo Fighters are the ~~greatest~~ most successful supergroup of all time. Fight me.

Edit: changed greatest to most successful cause I realized people have a difference of opinion.

But in case anyone was wondering

Dave Grohl: Scream/Nirvana

Pat Smear: The Germs

Nate Mendel: Sunny Day Real Estate

Chris Shiflett: No Use For A Name (RIP Tony Sly)

Taylor Hawkins: Alanis Morissette
Great music. Unfortunate name choice though…
The rrhof is a joke, but Pat hasn’t actually been a band member when Nirvana or the Foos wrote their classic songs.  He’s supporting cast,, at best.
This class of inductees almost had another Germs member in Belinda Carlisle AKA Dottie Danger, who was to be their drummer at one point.
Todd Rundgren 😎
Also appears in the lyrics of Sonic Youth song "Screaming Skull"
Im happy for Pat but why is BERNIE TAUPIN banned from the Hall of Fame and why hasnt Elton johns band been inducted FIRST?
Honestly, the Rock and Roll hall of fame induction is a joke. Many people should be in who are not. Many people are in who should not.

I have to confess that I think this is one of the worst classes of inductees ever.  Tina Turner’s primary legacy rests on the work she did with Ike…and Ike & Tina are already in the Hall.  Carole King’s primary legacy is as a songwriter, and she’s already been inducted as a songwriter.  Jay-Z is famous for everything but his music; primarily he’s most famous for making money.  If that’s the criteria for induction, then you might as well put Warren Buffett in the Hall.  And I like the Go-Go’s, but I don’t think they were good enough to put in the Hall of Fame.
wonder why they didn't actually write out the word shit. rock n roll is sorta about being more explicit?
It's good to see Kraftwerk get something since people like JayZ all sampled them.
About damn time.
Germs should have been inducted by now.
Woooooooo
It's funny, that was my first thought when I heard about it.
I’m happy Randy Rhodes is finally being recognized!
